body:
I found these snippets:
<details>
<summary>https://psalm.dev/r/9b36f33fc7</summary>

```php
<?php
  
ob_implicit_flush(0);
```

```
Psalm output (using commit c74b2fc):

No issues!
```
</details>

<details>
<summary>https://psalm.dev/r/583c732e91</summary>

```php
<?php
  
ob_implicit_flush(false);
```

```
Psalm output (using commit c74b2fc):

ERROR: InvalidArgument - 3:19 - Argument 1 of ob_implicit_flush cannot be false, int value expected
```
</details>

Thanks for reporting! This is an easy change, we have explanations on how to do it here: https://psalm.dev/docs/contributing/editing_callmaps/

Care for a PR?

Will make one! Did a quick search for the function name but didn't find anything.

With the docs I'm sure I'll figure it out

Github search seems to be pretty broken.. https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/search?q=ob_implicit_flush

issue.title: fix #8099: ob_implicit_flush argument type changed to bool

labels.name: release:fix
labels.description: The PR will be included in 'Fixes' section of the release notes

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.title: Autogenerate / verify callmap

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
I just created my first issue (#8099) and a PR to fix it. My knowledge of how psalm is created / structured is therefore very limited.

It occurred to me that we can very easily generate the callmap file, or alternatively verify it using reflection.

This quick proof of concept shows code to verify it:
```php
<?php

use phpDocumentor\Reflection\DocBlock\Tags\Var_;

$callMap = require "dictionaries/CallMap.php";

foreach(get_defined_functions(true)['internal'] as $functionName) {

    $rF = new ReflectionFunction($functionName);
    if (!isset($callMap[$functionName])) {
        // echo "Missing entry for function $functionName\n";
        continue;
    }
    $callMapEntry = $callMap[$functionName];

    $returnType = $callMapEntry[0] ?? 'mixed';
    unset($callMapEntry[0]);


    foreach($rF->getParameters() as $parameter) {
        $name = $parameter->getName();
        // echo "Checking {$parameter->getName()} for {$functionName}\n";
        $key = $parameter->isOptional() ? "{$name}=" : $name;

        if (!isset($callMapEntry[$key])) {
            echo "Missing param {$parameter->getName()} for function {$functionName}\n";
            continue;
        }

        $reflectionType = $parameter->getType();
        if (!isset($reflectionType) || $reflectionType instanceof ReflectionUnionType) {
            continue;
        } else {
            if ($reflectionType->getName() !== $callMapEntry[$key]) {
                echo "Type difference for {$name} in {$functionName}, reflection: {$reflectionType->getName()}, callmap: {$callMapEntry[$key]}\n";
             }
        }

     }
}
```


Running this on the `4.x` branch gives me a lot of output:
<details>
    <summary>Long list of (potential) errors in the callmap</summary>


</details>
Testing some of these randomly, shows that the errors are real: https://psalm.dev/r/5ba8343862

Is there any reason the callmap for the current version is not being autogenerated? (It can probably be done for older versions as well, assuming the reflection code works on it).



List of issue types that can be detected by implementing the test as done in #8104:

- [ ] #8106 
- [x] #8107 
- [x] #8108

Note that more types will be added to this list. A separate issue is created because while detection might be simple, a choice still needs to be made with regards to resolving the error.

body:
> Github search seems to be pretty broken

Unfortunately, callmaps ended up as huge files. Github just gave up on indexing or even showing those files :p
